summary: This hybrid course, offered by Bar-Ilan University's School of High-Tech and Cyber, is designed for technological managers and focuses on Data Science and Generative AI (GenAI). The course spans 5 sessions, totaling 25 academic hours, and is conducted on Mondays and Thursdays from 17:30 to 21:30. Participants can choose to attend either on-campus in Ramat Gan or via Zoom. The curriculum covers a comprehensive range of topics, including an overview of Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning, supervised, unsupervised, and semi-supervised learning, model selection, deep learning concepts, reinforcement learning, and the complete data science pipeline process. Additionally, the course delves into data science operation management, including managing the lifecycle of data science initiatives, building and managing data science units, and implementing successful organizational ML-OPS processes. Participants will also explore data science tools and technologies, industry trends, real-world use cases, and best practices. The course emphasizes Generative AI, including off-the-shelf solutions, platforms, self-development, and hybrid approaches. Key methodologies such as Prompt Engineering, Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG), Preferences Fine-Tuning (PFT), and Supervised Fine-Tuning (SFT) are covered. The program also addresses project milestones, technologies, and processes like tokenization, embedding, and vector databases.

COURSE NAME: Data Science & GenAI for Technological Managers

COURSE OVERVIEW: This course is designed to provide technological managers with advanced knowledge and skills in Data Science and Generative AI (GenAI). Participants will gain insights into the latest tools, technologies, and methodologies to manage data science initiatives effectively and implement AI-driven solutions in their organizations. The program is tailored to equip managers with the ability to oversee data science operations and leverage AI for strategic decision-making.

COURSE SCHEDULE:
- Start Date: December 19, 2024.
- Schedule: Mondays and Thursdays, 17:30-21:30.
- Duration: 5 sessions.
- Total Academic Hours: 25.

LEARNING FORMAT:
- Hybrid learning format.
- Classes will be held at Bar-Ilan University campus in Ramat Gan and via Zoom, based on participants' preference.

COURSE TOPICS:
1. Data Science:
   - Artificial Intelligence & Machine Learning Overview.
   - Supervised, Unsupervised, and Semi-Supervised Learning.
   - Model Selection: Straightforward Models and Ensembled Models.
   - Deep Learning: Neural Networks Concepts and Engineering.
   - Reinforcement Learning.
   - The Complete Data Science Pipeline Process.

2. Data Science Operation Management:
   - Managing Data Science Initiatives Life Cycle.
   - Building and Managing the Data Science Unit Efficiently.
   - Successful Organizational ML-OPS Process.
   - Data Science Tools and Technologies.

3. Data Science Tools and Technologies:
   - Industry and Market Watch.
   - Real-World Use Cases and Best Practices.
   - Large Language Models (NLP / NLU) and Omni Models.
   - Generative AI: Off-the-Shelf Solutions, Platforms, Self-Development, and Hybrid Approaches.
   - Key Approaches: Prompt Engineering, Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG), Preferences Fine-Tuning (PFT), Supervised Fine-Tuning (SFT), etc.
   - Project Milestones, Technologies, and Processes (e.g., Tokenization, Embedding, Vector Databases, etc.).

REGISTRATION AND CONTACT INFORMATION:
- To schedule an admission interview and register:
  - Phone: 052-5886002.
  - Email: esther.asulin@biu.ac.il.

INSTITUTIONAL INFORMATION:
- The course is offered by the School of High-Tech and Cyber at Bar-Ilan University.
- The program is part of the dedicated programs division of Bar-Ilan University.

TUITION AND FEES: Not specified in the provided text.
